title: Winner of $50million jackpot hasn't claimed prize but Sydney suburb where ticket was bought revealed
text:
The hunt continues for Australia's newest multimillionaire after Oz Lotto's $50 million jackpot went off on Tuesday night and still remains unclaimed.

The jackpot for draw 1339 rocketed to the third biggest offered so far this year with no division one winners for the last six weeks.the suburb where it was purchased has been revealed.

While the search for the lucky ticket holder continues the area where it was purchased has been revealed as Macarthur, in Sydney's south-west.

The hunt continues for Australia's newest multimillionaire after Oz Lotto's $50 million with the suburb where the ticket was bought being revealed (stock image)

The search for the lucky winner of the $50 million jackpot has been narrowed down to the southern Sydney region of Macarthur (pictured)

To protect the identity of the winner the name of the specific store the ticket was purchased in will not be revealed publicly.

Because the winning ticket wasn't bought by a person registered to a player card officials have no way of tracking them down.

The Lott spokesperson Bronwyn Spencer urged all residents of, or visitors to, the Macarthur region of southern Sydney to check their tickets.

'Imagine how much your life would change if you realised you were $50 million richer,' she said.

'There are 50 million reasons why all Macarthur region players who had an entry in last night's draw should check their ticket this morning.'

To protect the identity of the winner the name of the specific store the ticket was purchased in will not be revealed publicly

Ms Spencer also reminded players of the importance of registering their tickets to a player card.

'We were standing by the phone last night to call any registered division one winners and break the life-changing news but unfortunately we had no way of reaching our newest multi-millionaire,' she said.

In the 12 months to 30 June 2019, there were 17 division one winning Oz Lotto entries across Australia, totalling more than $334 million.

The numbers drawn on Tuesday night were 5, 32, 22, 13, 20, 25 and 42.

The supplementary numbers were 21 and 23.

Unregistered players in NSW are urged to check their tickets.

Twelve division two winners also won more than $42,000 each, including two from NSW.

Tuesday's night division one winner became the tenth Oz Lotto winner who have shared in $285 million won so far this year.

Three were from Victoria and NSW while Queensland had two.

Tasmania and South Australia have both had one Oz Lotto division one win.

All but two of the Oz Lotto division one winning entries so far this year have been QuickPick entries where the numbers were randomly generated.

The Oz Lotto jackpot was previously last won in August by an Adelaide man who won $10 million, who said at the time it was 'weird' to learn he had become a millionaire.

It comes after three winners shared the massive $150 million Powerball jackpot which went off last month.

The prize jackpotted from $100million after no winners claimed the first division prize in the previous draw.

Lottery officials said around half of all adult Australians entered the Powerball draw, which eclipses the previous record prize of $107.6 million which went off in January.

The next Oz Lotto draw is next Tuesday night.
description: The hunt continues for Australia's newest multimillionaire after Oz Lotto's $50 million jackpot went off on Tuesday night and still remains unclaimed.
authors: Adam Mccleery For Daily Mail Australia
